sense.name: a mathematical rectangular array of quantities manipulated according to certain rules
sense.examples: Our math instructor is teaching us matrix algebra. Two matrices may be added or multiplied together. Every matrix corresponds exactly to one linear transformation.

sense.name: fine-grained rock strata containing embedded fossils or minerals
sense.examples: The geologists found a matrix rich in trilobite fossils. This matrix is difficult to extract the gem ore from.

sense.name: management structure with two chains of command for each person
sense.examples: John's company recently adopted a matrix organization for management. With the matrix arrangement, Mary reports both to a VP of marketing and a Product Manager.

sense.name: intracellular substance
sense.examples: This toxin actually breaks down the matrix between the cells of the body. The matrix is the intracellular substance throughout an organism.

sense.name: formative tissue at base of a fingernail
sense.examples: The injury to John's finger damaged the matrix of his thumbnail.

sense.name: a surrounding context in which something develops
sense.examples: Five choices became the matrix of human life. Freedom of expression is the matrix, the indispensable condition, of nearly every form of freedom.(Benjamin N. Cardozo)

sense.name: an inscribed or engraved mold
sense.examples: They used a matrix for casting typefaces These stereotypes were created from a matrix.

sense.name: a 2D arrangement of things into rows and columns
sense.commentary: MATRIX[+structure][+physical][+arrangement][+2D][+elements] Note: resembles Sense 1, but is a physical layout of things, not a mathematical array.
sense.examples: The panel contained a matrix of diodes and transistors. The artist is known for his large abstract canvases with brightly colored matrices.
